name: G Hotel Penang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a deluxe room with an incredible sea view. It was my boyfriend's birthday, so they upgraded us, and even brought him a HUGE cake to the room! Tasty ice cream on arrival, complimentary sweets brought to the room, amazing buffet breakfast, the quality and diversity of the food was great.
reviews.title: Fancy pants hotel - great for a birthday treat!

reviews.text: The staff were lovely, and despite it being a boutique hotel, it wasn't stuffy, and we didn't feel out of place arriving with our muddy bikes and flip flops!! They even put our bikes in a safe place out the back!
reviews.title: Fantastic place to be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in an executive suite for 2 nights over the Hari Raya weekend.
reviews.title: The Service From Executive Floor Team Was Excellent

reviews.text: The suite has a separate living room and is spacious, clean and bright. The room overlooks the sea and it has an iPod docking system. Housekeeping did a great job in keeping the room clean and tidy.
reviews.title: Stunning!!

reviews.text: We accidentally left a pack of baby wet wipes in the executive lounge and the staff traced it back to us and delivered it back to our room, we didnt even realise it is missing! Lounge is open 24hours although there is only beverage and fruits after hours.
reviews.title: Unforgettable stay

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and offers an excellent buffet suitable for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The gym and pool facilities are well kept, with the treadmills offering a stunning view of the Malacca Strait. A shopping mall is adjacent to the hotel, so no worries if something is forgotten. And a local food market is nearby that was very busy during the evening hours. The hotel has a business center, and offers bicycles rentals. The staff was courteous and helpful. Be mindful while the hotel overlooks the water, there is no beach access or swimming. Batu Ferringhi is approximately a 30-45 minute taxi ride away. The hotel offered shuttle service to the night market on Friday evening, but check with the hotel.
reviews.title: Good hotel located adjacent to Mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, we ( my fiancee and I ) would like to dedicate many thanks to the support of the G hotel management during our stays in the executive lounge floor. They made every impossible to be possible. Their service is the best ever we received. We will definitely come back again in the next.
reviews.title: Memorable stay to our love story !!!

reviews.text: THUMB UP!!!! I LOVE G HOTEL!!!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel - one of the best in Asia IMO

reviews.text: From: Mr Leslie Leong and his mrs.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: In my opinion, one of the best in Asia, when compared with the rest. Room was excellent and very comfy. Pity had only 1 night at the hotel. Very convenient with the Gurney plaza beside the hotel for all your shopping needs!
reviews.title: G Hotel equal to EXCELLENT

reviews.text: I had to organise an event in Penang for the company and i wanted something different instead of the hotel we usually book. It was my first time organizing this event so i had a lot to loose. But i really have to thank the G-hotel and team. They have been great with everything, spectacular service, beautifull rooms, good location.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't complain, there was nothing that could not be arranged. You name it, i got it. It was nice to be there and everyone liked it.
reviews.title: Really disappointed

reviews.text: I will definitly go back to the G-hotel!
reviews.title: The best of 5 hotels I 'd stayed in Penang Island during my 9 days trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked the Executive floor for 6 nights and was so disappointed. The room was fine but the bed is so hard. Hotel is clinical and cold rather than trendy. The decor is looking slightly tired. We were extremely upset as my husband spilt some red wine on a towel. We then received a bill for £18 for cleaning! We disputed this and the charge was dropped but it sure put a damper on our stay there. Good points are that the Executive Lounge offers a fine snacks.
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.text: Food wise...there is a really good fish restaurant nearby 5 min walk from hotel plus the Hawker Centre offers tasty cheap food
reviews.title: Fantastic stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice place.. the service all very good and excellent..
reviews.title: Excellent, nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We read previous reviews about this hotel and based on these booked up. What a disappointment! Vastly over priced and certainly not value for money. Whilst it looked the part on first arrival we soon started to notice a significant lack of attention to detail in terms of overall cleanliness and the need to renew or refurbish tired looking fixtures and fittings. The bed in our executive room was the hardest (not firm, downright hard) I have ever experienced and the meal we ordered through room service lacked both quantity and quality. The reception lacks atmosphere or any welcoming charm.
reviews.title: All that glitters is not gold

reviews.text: If you're thinking about a trip to Penang, there's much better hotels out there and you'll pay a lot less for them!
reviews.title: Perfect stay with excellent service

reviews.text: A hotel which is always busy with the merriment of festivities can be felt right at the lobby. We had a great experience right from making reservations to the checking in and having breakfasts at the executive lounge until the last day of checking out. The staff have been very well trained. We can feel the genuine smiles and the way they handle us the customers. We feel very welcomed and particularly at the Executive Lounge headed by Mr Balan. His service is commendable. You will feel very well taken care of by him and his staff even though the place gets busy over breakfast and tea time. We stayed in a executive deluxe room , very spacious, all drinks in the minibar is foc, plenty of bottled water supplied daily. We have been to many hotels over the years, it's always the hotel staff that makes the stay memorable or otherwise. Going to Pg? g Hotel it is. easy excess to shopping, food and to everywhere in the island.
reviews.title: Service compromises on quality of stay

reviews.text: We arrived at 10am at the hotel and was told that the rooms were to be ready by 2pm. Thus, we went out and came back at two, with only 4 out of the 6 rooms ready, so the rest of us without rooms were told to wait at the lobby until a front desk staff member approached us to hand us the keys.
reviews.title: First timers at the G-Hotel and we are very pleased and satifsfied

description: Malaysia's Most Stylish Address ~ G Hotel Penang. A bold and gorgeous hotel with a touch of cool modernity, it also offers luxurious rooms with an excellent selection of designer furniture. G Hotel Penang overlooks Penang’s most famous boulevard Gurney drive. Clients can enjoy the benefits of being near to the sea, the shopping and dining attractions along the promenade including Gurney Plaza and Gurney drive’s legendary hawker’s food enclave. Tourists can appreciate the proximity to Gurney Drive beach, known for its clear waters. Business travelers can opt for the serviced residences and can easily reach the CBD by taxi. All rooms have flat screen TV with satellite channels and complimentary high speed internet access. Facilities include a well equipped gym, outdoor pool and business center. Dining options are plentiful with a choice of three restaurants all serving wide menus of International and local cuisine and snacks.
